question:
What is the following code's output? 
string_val = "Hello World"
for c in string_val:
  if c == " ":
    break
  print(c)

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The loop iterates over characters in the string_val variable and loop execution terminates as soon as a space character is reached. Hence, the output cannot contain a space character.

The loop iterates over characters in the string_val variable and until a space character is encountered, prints characters, one in each line. Additionally, print() introduces a newline so the characters will not be printed in the same line.

answers.text:
H
e
l
l
o

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback:
The code prints all characters before the first occurrence of a space character in separate lines. Hence the output is: 
H
e
l
l
o

detailedSolution:
The code prints all characters before the first occurrence of a space character in separate lines. Hence the output is:
